episodes.natural_language:
Initial client contact on August 27, 2025 with Justin regarding a motor vehicle accident involving Jonah Price. The client is Jonah Price, born September 28, 1989, with Social Security Number 407-37-4981 and phone number 502-356-4203. He resides at 3101 Elliot Ave, Louisville, KY 40211. The date of the accident was August 25, 2025, at Dixie Highway near the old Hooters, where he was rear-ended while stopped at a light. The incident was investigated by the Louisville Metro Police Department (LMPD), Report Number 25100181. He went to UofL Downtown for treatment, and the documented injuries are to the back and left leg.

Medical history includes a prior gunshot wound about a year and a half ago, treated at UofL. His health insurance is Passport. The Uber driver involved in the incident was driving a white Ford Explorer. Lost wages are expected to be provided via Elmwood Staffing.

Date and time of this contact: August 27, 2025. Person making contact: Justin.
episodes.author: Aaron

episodes.original_body:
Case: Jonah-Price-MVA-8-25-2025
Client: Jonah Price

Completed comprehensive case file organization for Jonah-Price-MVA-8-25-2025 using 5-phase systematic workflow with content-only mode (filename bias elimination). Processed 26 total files: moved 10 document pairs (20 files) to proper 8-bucket locations with standardized naming convention, identified and deleted 6 duplicate files. All files now organized in Client/, Investigation/, and Insurance/PIP/Progressive/ folders. Key documents organized: intake documents (10/9/2025), police report (Master File #73223930), Progressive PIP correspondence (7 documents including dec page, LOR, acknowledgments, application package, preservation letter). Verified 100% naming convention compliance and PDF+MD companion matching. Generated 5 comprehensive reports documenting inventory, mapping, quality review (10% error rate - 1 date correction), and final verification. Case folder structure now fully compliant with 8-bucket system and ready for active case management. Important findings documented: PIP carrier is Progressive (Rasier LLC policy #06258582), not Mobilitas; at-fault driver Shaun Travis (Unit 1) had defective brakes; client was passenger in Unit 2 driven by Donald Kidwell (Uber driver); no UM/UIM coverage on Rasier policy (rejected 2/28/2025); $10,000 PIP coverage available.
episodes.natural_language:
Case: Jonah-Price-MVA-8-25-2025. The client is Jonah Price. A comprehensive case file organization for Jonah-Price-MVA-8-25-2025 was completed using a five-phase systematic workflow in content-only mode to eliminate filename bias. A total of 26 files were processed: 10 document pairs (20 files) were moved to proper eight-bucket locations with a standardized naming convention, and six duplicate files were identified and deleted. All materials are now organized within the Client/, Investigation/, and Insurance/PIP/Progressive/ folders.

Key documents were organized, including intake documents dated 10/9/2025, the police report filed under Master File #73223930, and Progressive PIP correspondence consisting of seven documents, including the declaration page, the LOR, acknowledgments, the application package, and a preservation letter.

Naming convention compliance was verified at 100%, and PDF+MD companion files were confirmed to match. Five comprehensive reports were generated documenting inventory, mapping, quality review (noting a 10% error rate with one date corrected), and final verification. The case folder structure is now fully compliant with the eight-bucket system and ready for active case management.

Important findings: the PIP carrier is Progressive (Rasier LLC policy #06258582), not Mobilitas; the at-fault driver Shaun Travis (Unit 1) had defective brakes; the client was a passenger in Unit 2 driven by Donald Kidwell, an Uber driver; there is no UM/UIM coverage on the Rasier policy, which was rejected on 2/28/2025; and $10,000 PIP coverage is available.
episodes.author: Roscoe (AI Paralegal)

about.relevance: case client / subject of the file organization
previously presumed PIP carrier (explicitly ruled out in favor of Progressive/Rasier)
